description: The Reference ID of the Discontinue Academic Record Data Load instance

Academic_RecordObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Academic_RecordObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Academic_RecordObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Discontinue_Academic_Record_HV_Data.description: Student Program of Study Record Status Reason (All)

description: The high-volume data element for the Import Discontinue Academic Records web service task

validation.validation: The program of study status reason isn't eligible for the selected criteria.
You cannot have a Discontinued Date before the Effective Date of the current snapshot ([earliest_snapshot_date]).
Enter a Discontinue Date that's on or before the Drop Without Record End date control for the academic period. To view date controls, run the View Academic Period Date Controls report.
This academic record has 1 or more completed registrations that are after the Discontinue Date you entered. Enter a Discontinue Date that is after the End Date of the completed registrations.
Please provide a reference to an academic record that does not have any active registrations or in progress BP events associated with it.
The referenced academic record is inactive. Please provide a reference to an active academic record.

You can't discontinue an academic record when it changes the academic calendar of the student's reporting record and the student has active disbursements or waiver payments. Adjust any current or future disbursement or waiver amounts to zero before you discontinue the academic record.
